subject: Some Odds, Some Ends
event: I miss football already. Looking forward to the draft. Not looking forward to months of fighting between the owners and players, and maybe a lockout/ strike. Things are rolling along nicely on the Ice & Fire comic book. Check out the new interview with Daniel Abraham on Suvudu: http://graphic-novels-manga.suvudu.com/2011/02/interview-daniel-abraham-on-grrm-comics.html Suvudu also informs me of a new round of Cage Matches, wherein Jon Snow will be one of the contestants. Details here: http://sf-fantasy.suvudu.com/2011/02/cage-match-2011-its-coming.html I never had the chance to talk about their "Villains" Cage Match (too busy), in which Ser Gregor Clegane emerged victorious over a murderer's rows of nasties and narsties from screen and page. Congratulations to the Mountain That Rides, and thanks to all of you who voted! There's been lots of talk about ebooks and digital publishing swirling around me of late. It's a brave new world for this old dinosaur. Kindles, Nooks, iPads, iPods, ebooks, PODs, all confusing as hell. But it is something that I am looking into for some of my backlist titles... some of the out of print Wild Cards books might be well received in such formats, I think. So expect news on that front eventually, though maybe not soon. I have this other book I'm writing, you know, and that comes first. I can deal with putting the old wine in new bottles when that's done. That being said, y'know, I DO have some stuff available as ebooks and downloads, for all of you who have been asking. Check out my listings on Fictionwise and Electric Story if you would like to sample some of it: http://www.fictionwise.com/eBooks/GeorgeRRMartineBooks.htm https://www.electricstory.com/authors/author.aspx?authorid=78 Meanwhile, over in miniature town, the good folks at Dark Sword are rolling out four great new Tom Meier sculpts in their Ice & Fire range: the Reed siblings, Meera and Jojen, and a double of Hodor (HODOR!) with Bran riding on his back. Have a look at the greens. The new minis should be available soon from the Dark Sword website at http://darkswordminiatures.com/ Along with the rest of the range, of course. Should also mention that Hugo nominations are now open, for members of the current worldcon (Reno) and the last one (Melbourne). I did not have a novel out last year (some of you might have noticed that), but I am eligible to be nominated in Best Editor/ Short Form for my anthology work with Gardner Dozois, and in the novella category for "The Mystery Knight" from WARRIORS. All the other stories in WARRIORS and SONGS OF LOVE AND DEATH are eligible as well. I hope you will consider some of them when filling out your ballot; I think there was some fine work in both books, worthy of recognition. And let me once again suggest that it is long past time that MICHAEL KOMARCK was nominated as Best Pro Artist. His cover art for Wild Cards has been extraordinary, and he's done amazing work for other books as well. Must run now. Kong is calling.

props.taglist: hugo awards, nfl, anthologies, awards, miniatures, dark sword, comic books

comments.article:
Can't say I'm looking forward to the next football season, as I'm dreading what the Dolphins are going to put me through...

We've also done an additional interview with Daniel over at at Westeros. Working on one with Tommy right now.

I did not realize Howard Who? was available via Fictionwise (it's getting listed as one of your books because of the introduction it looks like). Hmm... *puts it on the list*

Speaking of e-books, a pretty common thing I'm seeing these days is people trying to track down the individual Dunk & Egg novellas. Obviously, "The Mystery Knight" is still pretty new, but having "The Hedge Knight" or "The Sworn Sword" available as standalone e-books might be a good idea. A lot of people seem to buy the graphic novels, not realizing they're comic adaptations rather than the prose originals, so there's definitely an interest.
I'm a Dolphins fan too!
They are works of art and I can't wait. Painting miniatures is a hobby of patience, precision and dedication to excellence. The exact qualities you possess that make waiting for Kong worth the wait!
comments.subject: More miniatures!

comments.article:
Yay, finally some more miniature pictures! I love the one of Hodor and Bran! Hodor looks so... confused!

I hope you get nominated for best editor! It goes to show that you excell in all the areas you delve into! Good luck and don't worry about Kong - patience is a virtue that you posess, good ser!

NFL-free time sucks big. But I look forward to your analysis of the draft and its implications on the next season. Your observations are always on the spot! Meanwhile, I`ll pass the time reading my worn-out copy of "Wildcards" and devouring a delicious family-size pizza.

There are a couple of Wild Cards, on Kindle (as well as Songs of Love and Death and Warriors).

Fortunately, I have hockey season, to tide me over.
What team are you cheering for? I am a Leafs fan,unfortunately. I think the odds of the Leafs making the playoffs are slightly less than Kong being slayed this tomorrow.
comments.subject: which team?

comments.article: I should point out that these are ebook versions of "Sandkings" the novellette and "Nightflyers" the novella, not SANDKINGS and NIGHTFLYERS the short-story collections.  In other words, the stories are being offered singly.

Miniatures are glorious! I have purchased many of dark sword miniatures in past. Miniature are strong family tradition in fact. Father was in glorious Soviet Union army years and years ago and made for me soap miniatures. I painted for him and send them back. I send him great red dragon of HOBBIT, and Shea Omsford in green cloak of SWORDS OF SHANNARA. Father came back from great patriotic duty and still had miniature and this is displayed in living room of parent home now.

Now I add Martin minature of FIRE AND ICE songs to shelf with them! But no WILD CARDS miniature for sale anywhere :< I try carving Jet Boy but I am thinking I am not as good as father.

Jon Snow's a slam-dunk winner of that cage match, if I have anything to say about it. He's my favorite character by far, and I can't wait until we can read more about his rise to greatness at the Wall.

I know we've waited awhile to see him in action again, but a cage match will feel like he's right there amongst us, your characterization being such a strong point. Perhaps you can be persuaded to write a little excerpt of his battle against whoever he is pitted against? Please make it as humorous and entertaining as you do your posts here.
I was wondering if you had time to read the the finally battle between Rand and the Mountain and what you thought of the Mountain's victory write-up.
comments.subject: Villans Cage Match

comments.article: Oh no - there is FitzChivalry and Logan Ninefingers in that list - I'm not sure John Snow has that level of awesome (sorry GGRM!) Fitz will always have a rather sad place in my heart. (DO SOMETHING YOU IMBECILE - GET YOUR LOVE BACK FFS.... OH GOD FINE)
Jon v. Fitz would also mean Ghost v. Nighteyes, I'm sure. I think Ghost wins that one.  No ordinary wolf, even one as cool as Nighteyes, is a match for a direwolf.

Being able to have the entire Wild Cards series in my pocket will be a dream come true.

any chance of getting the old Wild Cards novels in audio book ????
comments.subject: Hell YES

comments.article: We're working on that.
comments.subject: Re: Hell YES

comments.article:
Here's hoping everyone is wrong about the NFL lockouts - it would be miserable to be without our favorite players for a whole season. There are so few things to count on every year as a fan, but the NFL is one of them.
As for the rest of this post, I'd like to request you push for Wildcards books to get released on Kobo reader. For those of us without big money for a Kindle or Nook, it would still be great to get my hands on all the old Wildcards books. Like getting a whole pile of new books from you in 2011!
comments.subject: NFL lockout

comments.article: Actually I have Kobo as well and there is wonderful program on internet to be converting files. http://calibre-ebook.com/ you can modify file extension so it can be placed on Kobo ereader.
comments.subject: Re: NFL lockout

comments.article:
I'm not as much into miniatures as much as I am into Wildcards and all the other stuff, but I would totally buy that Hodor one if it had a pull string that made him say "Hodor Hodor Hodor!" and then Bran asked if he could fly...that would be hilarious.

Quick question/joke: Are you holding out releasing Dance because you don't want to spoil the ending for us? (You should totally use that line next time some jerk asks you about ADWD.)
comments.subject: OK

comments.article: Thanks for the update. Thats great news about Wild Cards, I have a really tough time finding copies. Its been ages since I saw one in a bookstore. Shame they went out of print.
comments.subject: Wild Cards

comments.article: KONG KONG KONG KONG. . . sorry I can't help it.
I can't wait for those comics, the art looks crisp.

A friend of mine told me about this show coming out on HBO. He said the books are amazing and i should read them. So here i am first time poster. I was very exited in seeing the miniatures because i play dungeons and dragons and collect miniatures. I thought the mini of the man with the boy on his back would be cool and i could use it to create a fun character. It begs the question "why is he in a basket on the mans back"? Very intriguing.

I cant wait to start the books, I have read High praise about them on the internet. I love starting a series that is almost finished. That way i have a short wait for the Finale.
comments.subject: new fan

comments.article: I was wondering the same thing myself.  I heard about the series from the HBO commercials.  Fantasy isn't normally my thing but this show looks really cool.  I've almost finished the first couple of chapters of the first book and I don't see the point of having Bran being carried around like a backpack.  What is he tired from all the climbing he does?  The kid is clearly destined to be some great warrior in service to his father and brother and not some lazy lump who needs to be carried around like a sack of meat.
comments.subject: RE: Backpack boy

comments.article:
My GF just got a nook over Xmas, and I finally got her reading A Game of Thrones. We've been listening to the book with Roy Dotrice(who is among the best narrators) while we read. It only took me a year...and a new ebook reader. She loves Sansa.

I hope your recovery is going well! Happy Friday!
comments.subject: Ebooks

comments.article: It might well be in your interest to bring your out-of-print works out in a digital format yourself, and stake your claim to your copyright, than to allow Google to do it for you.  I have no real idea how close-knit the fantasy author scene is, but I certainly hope you have heard at least dim rumblings of the ruckus that fantasy grande-dame Ursula K. LeGuin is raising over this issue, but I do feel it is something to bear in mind.
comments.subject: Regarding Ebooks &c.

comments.article: I haven't heard of a ruckus involving Ursula.  Do you have more information on that?
comments.subject: Re: Regarding Ebooks &c.

comments.article:
Sandkings! I just read... well... listened to this for the first time today! I listen audiobooks non-stop at work and have been really enjoying the Dreamsongs books, especially with your intros. I loved Sandkings... and I won't lie, I was secretly rooting for those clever little bugs.

Monkey Treatment was a lot of fun... listened to that one right before lunch, and I think being HUNGRY added something special to that listen. Haha. I'll have you know, my lunch tasted GREAT today and I was quite happy to be able to eat it!

Pear Shaped Man genuinely creeped me out. Thank you. I'm now afraid of cheese doodles. I did love hearing Roy Dotrice's voice as well... it always makes me smile.

Okay... enough of my gushing.

This might be a dumb question, but... why are those little figurines made green? I know they're made to be painted but wouldn't they be easier to paint if they started out white, or a neutral beige or brown or such?

(they look neat, though)

The figures are cast in pewter.

The greens are the original sculpts. Tom Meier, like many mini sculptors, works in a soft putty-ish medium called "greenstuff."

I recently asked Voyager if the UK ebook of A DANCE WITH DRAGONS would be released on the same day as the hardcover, and they said it would, providing no hiccups. Good news after some recent high-profile fantasy novels delayed their ebook editions by six months after the hardcover came out.

It might also be worth noting that Voyager are in the middle of re-releasing the UK ebooks of ASoIaF. AGoT and ACoK should be out now, ASoS (back in one volume!) in a couple of weeks and AFFC by April. The American ebooks have also be cleared up and most of their typos and mistakes rectified, which is good news.
Maybe Voyager is so responsive because they think they will get free publicity with another release of Tuf Voyager?

I'd really love to see Komarck illustrate one of the Subterranean Press limited editions. He did illustrate their Gardens of the Moon, with some rather stunning artwork (especially his Anomander Rake pieces).
...this time around I'm rooting for Martin the Warrior! Childhood hero :D
comments.subject: Sorry to say it but...
